result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lugene Alfondonis Mitchell

records.addlTxt: Outpatient Competency Admission Decision; Received and Filed.
of Commitment for Treatment, signed and filed.  rmm

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lugene Alfondonis Mitchell in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Lugene Alfondonis Mitchell.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Court ordered the stayed warrant vacated.  Doctor's report reviewed by the parties.  All parties agree with the report.  The court finds the defendant not competent to proceed but likely to become competent within the statutory time period.  if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  The court orders the proceedings suspended and committed the defendant to the Department of Health Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  Court ordered the defendant be referred to the Outpatient Restoration to Competency Program.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lugene Alfondonis Mitchell not in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Lugene Alfondonis Mitchell.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. Case set for return on doctor's report.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Lugene Alfondonis Mitchell in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a status conference. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Defendant has scheduled appointment with Dr. Matt Seipel on 08-18-2022 at 11:30am, Room 504 Safety Building. Case remains calendared in Br. 01.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lugene Alfondonis Mitchell in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lugene Alfondonis Mitchell appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 01.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lugene Alfondonis Mitchell in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Pretrial conference held.  This case may be transferred to Veteran's court and Atty. Obscherning requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
No contact order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Juan G, Alpa N P, or 4600 S. 27th St.

Defendant Lugene Alfondonis Mitchell in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Lugene Alfondonis Mitchell in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lugene Alfondonis Mitchell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
